overview: Karin Giblin was two years old when her family fled from Northern  Germany during WWII. After living in a displaced persons camp for  several years, the Red Cross relocated her family to the small town of  Bad Friedrichshall Kochendorf.  Remembering Kochendorf tells the story of Karin, along with her  sister Marianne, returning to Bad Friedrichshall to reconnect with  friends and places that they haven't seen in over 50 years.
title: Remembering Kochendorf
